thread.title: Do's top 10 list: Monet, Fright Fest, Monty Python should be on your Savannah schedule
thread.title_full: Do's top 10 list: Monet, Fright Fest, Monty Python should be on your Savannah schedule

author: Heather Henley
title: Do's top 10 list: Monet, Fright Fest, Monty Python should be on your Savannah schedule
text:
From a new Monet exhibition at the Jepson to the Ministry of Silly Walks from Monty Python's Eric Idle and John Cleese, Savannah's got a little something for everyone coming up on the events schedule. 

“Monet and American Impressionism”: Oct. 16-Jan. 24, 2016; Monet Soirée is 5-10 p.m. Oct. 15; Jepson Center, 207 W. York St.; admission price varies 

“How to Make a Warhol” Printmaking Demonstration: 2-4 p.m. Oct. 16; Non-Fiction Gallery, 1522 Bull St.; free 
Art Rise Savannah’s Factory Party: 7-11 p.m. Oct. 16; Non-Fiction Gallery, 1522 Bull St.; $47.99, includes free drinks and food 

Mountain Buzz: The Accomplices EP Release Party: 7:30 p.m. Oct. 16; Georgia State Railroad Museum Roundhouse, 655 Louisville Road; $20 in advance and $25 door; $15 for ages 15 and younger 

The Purple Party: 7 p.m. Oct. 16; Barrelhouse South, 125 W. Congress St.; free admission; 21 and older 

Graveface Records & Curiosities Fourth Anniversary Party: 6 p.m. Oct. 16; Graveface Records & Curiosities, 5 W. 40th St.; free 
Graveface Fright Fest: 4 p.m. to 2 a.m. Oct. 17-18; Lucas Theatre for the Arts, 32 Abercorn St.; $21 in advance; $26 at the door; $51 VIP, available in advance only 

Geekend: 3-7:30 p.m. Oct. 15; 8:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. Oct. 16; 9 a.m.-midnight Oct. 17; The Guild Hall, 615 Montgomery St.; $250-$550; 10 percent savings for Savannah Morning News readers with code “SMN” 

17th annual Great Ogeechee Seafood Festival: 5-11 p.m. Oct. 16; 10 a.m. to 11 p.m. Oct. 17; 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 18; J.F. Gregory Park, 521 Cedar St., Richmond Hill; $5 Friday and Sunday for those 16 and older and $10 Saturday; $5 for children ages 6-15; free for children 5 and younger 

The Vienna Boys Choir in concert: 7 p.m. Oct. 17; Armstrong State University Fine Arts Auditorium, 11935 Abercorn St.; $25, $45, $65 or $100 VIP reserved 

Tybee Island Kids Shark Tooth/Fossil Hunt: 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 18; Tybee Island, North Beach; $20 advance; $25 day of event 

View the Do Savannah "Big Calendar" mobile app 

We love to hear from our readers, and there are plenty of ways to get in touch: on Facebook , through Twitter , or email at
